item.title: Cannot sweep leaves from road, 29th September
item.description:
We are lucky to live in a tree lined avenue, but when leaves shed they seem to collect mostly in front of our home! Unfortunately when the road sweeper comes round there is often someone’s vehicle parked in front of our house therefore the road cannot be swept. I am happy to sweep the leaves and bag them, but I am already paying £80 a year for a garden waste bin (mostly for the leaves from the road as I have a tiny garden!). Is there an alternative in the autumn to filling up my green waste bin?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cloisters Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers left here for weeks, 29th September
item.description:
These barriers have been left since the roofs were replaced weeks ago. They are being dragged around by children and left in dangerous locations - across footpaths and in the road. Currently the legs/feet of the barriers are under the tree on the green opposite. There is also rubbish dumped against the fence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kellaway Road, Kidbrooke, London

item.title: Minefield created by dog poo, 29th September
item.description:
I am writing to raise a serious and ongoing concern regarding the large amount of dog fouling outside St Margaret Clitherow Primary School, particularly along Southwood road. The situation has become increasingly unpleasant and unsafe for children, parents, and school staff. The pavement often resembles a minefield, with dog mess scattered so frequently that it’s difficult to avoid — especially during busy school drop-off and pick-up times. This is not only a health hazard but also a safety issue, as children are at risk of stepping in it, slipping, or even bringing it into the school building. I kindly request that the council increase the frequency of street cleaning in this area and consider additional signage or enforcement to deter irresponsible dog owners. This is a high-traffic area for families and deserves to be kept clean and safe. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to seeing some action taken soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwood Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
